page.title: 11MAYPOLE FETE
page.content: The village fete, an event held annually in May, takes place in the grounds of Stockland Village Hall. At the fete the local schoolchildren participate in the age-old tradition of{Maypole Dancing.}Each child holds a ribbon and rotates in a variety of movements around the pole, producing different patterns in the ribbons. The dance itself was originally used to welcome the warmth of summer, but is now kept as a tradition. Besides the dancing there are several stalls where money can be lost or won. There is also a donkey derby where the children become jockeys and race against each other. There is a tote where bets are placed on these races. David Sutton,11
